revised_title: Experimental Study of Viscous Liquid Motion Between Coaxial Cylinders
tldr: This article investigates the motion of a viscous liquid contained between two coaxial cylinders that can rotate independently. The authors study the stability of the liquid motion and the critical speed at which the motion becomes unstable. They also explore different types of motion after the laminar motion becomes unstable and compare the speeds of the inner cylinder at which vortices come in and go out.
